text: Hi, I'm your virtual healthcare agent. I can help answer your healthcare claims questions, understand your benefits, and find a doctor. How can I assist you today?

Sure, I can help you find a doctor.

Please note, if this is a medical emergency, go to your local emergency room.
What is your member ID?
What is your date of birth? You can say the date as October 22 ,1982.
Who is the primary subscriber?
To confirm, you would like to see a doctor for virtual care?

It is open between 9am-5pm Monday to Friday. 

I can transfer you to an agent who can assist with scheduling an appointment.

text.text: please tell me what are deductibles

text: I am happy to help you understand your benefits.
Thank you. It appears you have an individual health plan. The benefits for you are as follows:

Your annual individual in network deductible is $2000 and you have $1,200 remaining for the year.
Your out of network deductible is $4000 and you have $1,400 remaining for the year.

Do you require more assistance?

A deductible is the amount of money you need to pay before your health insurance will start to pay a portion of the cost of your care. A deductible is different from the monthly premium you pay via payroll deduction for your overall insurance.

Do you require more assistance?

A premium is the amount that you pay for your health insurance plan. It's paid by you, your employer, or shared. It is generally deducted from your pay check.

Do you require more assistance?

Health Savings Accounts (or HSAs) can be opened by employees who have a high-deductible health plan. You can put money in a HSA up to a set annual limit which is then treated as tax advantaged.

Do you require more assistance?

Sometimes two insurance plans work together to pay claims for the same person. That process is called coordination of benefits.

Do you require more assistance?
Thank you. It appears you have an individual health plan. The benefits for you are as follows:

When you see a primary care, specialist, or urgent care provider you have 10% co-insurance in network and 30% co-insurance out of network.

Do you require more assistance?

text.text: what is the status of my claims

text:

text.text: what is the cost for regular healthcheckup

text:
Sure, I can help you find a doctor and answer your billing questions.

Please note, if this is a medical emergency, go to your local emergency room.

Actual charges may vary among providers, but for your in network provider you are covered at 100% (no deductible or co-pay) for a yearly preventative physical and for your out of network provider you pay 30%, after the plan deductible is met.

Do you require more assistance?
